footprintR 0.1.0

    • Using `footprintR`

Get read-level data for a region from a modBAM file.

Source: R/getReadDataForRegion.R
getReadDataForRegion.Rd

This function returns a RangedSummarizedExperiment object with read-level footprinting data extracted for a specific region from a bamfile in modBAM format. getReadDataForRegion() is a convenience wrapper around three other functions that could also be called independently from one another:

modkitExtract

runs modkit and extracts the read-level base modification information from a modBAM file.

readModkitExtract

reads the resulting output from modkit into a SummarizedExperiment object.

filterReadData

calculates quality measures and optionally filters out data from low quality reads.

getReadDataForRegion(
  bamfile,
  region,
  arglist.modkitExtract = list(modkit_bin = "modkit"),
  arglist.readModkitExtract = list(),
  arglist.filterReadData = NULL,
  assay.type = "mod_prob",
  verbose = FALSE
)

Arguments

bamfile

Character scalar with the name of a modBAM file (a BAM file that stores modified-base data).

region

A GRanges object with a single region for which data should be extracted from bamfile. Alternatively, the region can be specified as a character scalar (e.g. "chr1:1200-1300") that can be coerced into a GRanges object.

arglist.modkitExtract

A named list with further argument to pass to modkitExtract (must not contain bamfile or regions, which are set automatically).

arglist.readModkitExtract

A named list with further argument to pass to readModkitExtract (must not contain fnames, which is set automatically).

arglist.filterReadData

A named list with further argument to pass to filterReadData. Alternatively, it can be set to NULL, in which case no filtering will be performed.

assay.type

A string scalar specifying the assay name to store modification probabilities.

verbose

If TRUE, report on progress.

Value

A RangedSummarizedExperiment object with positions of modified bases in rows and reads in the columns.

See also

SummarizedExperiment for the returned object type, modkitExtract for calling modkit, readModkitExtract for the function used to read the modkit output and filterReadData for filtering read-level footprinting data.

Author

Michael Stadler

Examples

if (FALSE) { # \dontrun{
modbamfile <- system.file("extdata", "6mA_1_10reads.bam", package = "footprintR")
se <- getReadDataForRegion(modbamfile,
                           region = "chr1:6940000-6955000",
                           arglist.readModkitExtract = list(modbase = "a"))
se
} # }
